sessions.description: Kotlin is now an officially supported language for Android. This session provides an introduction to the language, covering basic concepts and tips for developers to get started with it.

sessions.title: App Reviews: App Consultations
sessions.description: Meet with Google Play experts to get personalized advice on improving your app performance.

sessions.title: Using Pirate Metrics to grow your user base
sessions.description:
Pirate Metrics is a systematic way of driving growth for your business or app. It's based on driving a great experience through focusing on Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Revenue and Referral or AARRR!

In this session, Parul and Laurence talk about Pirate Metrics and how a number of Firebase technologies can be used to aid in growing your audience. We'll look at each of these columns in turn, taking a deep dive into how to activate your users by giving them a great experience, how remote config in particular can be used here, as well as how to get strong customer referral using dynamic links and invites!

sessions.title: Office Hours: Mobile App Growth, Monetization and Measurement Office Hours
sessions.description: Interested in learning about app growth strategies? Have questions about how to effectively monetize your app? Want to know the best way to calculate LTV? Interested in learning more about AMP ads? Get all your questions answered by app ads product experts during the Mobile Apps Office Hours at Google IO.

sessions.title: Office Hours with the Gsuite team
sessions.description: Our team will be available to answer your questions about collaboration and productivity applications like GMail, Google Docs, and messaging applications.

sessions.title: Using Firebase to accelerate app growth: overview & updates
sessions.description: In this session, we'll dive into some of Firebase's growth-oriented products and features. We'll explain how they work and how you can take advantage of them to accelerate the growth of your app.

sessions.title: Future, faster: Unlock the power of Web Components with Polymer
sessions.description: It took a few years and a couple of trips around the block, but Web Components have truly arrived: they're natively supported in Chrome and Safari today, with other browsers joining the party soon. Polymer is still the most popular way to build your own Web Components. Polymer 2.0 has been updated to the final v1 Web Components specs, getting leaner, faster and more modular along the way - and offering a seamless upgrade path from Polymer 1. In this session, you will learn how Web Components and Polymer can help you build performant, maintainable web apps that unlock the full potential of the browser. You'll also hear about the latest advancements in the Polymer library that are bringing Polymer development closer to native than ever before, like ES6 class-based syntax and a suite of tools.

sessions.title: PullString: Storytelling in the Age of Conversational Interfaces
sessions.description: While the medium may change, the story remains the key element in engaging audiences. Come learn from the storytelling masters at PullString how they apply the learnings from over a decade working at Pixar to the new medium of conversational interfaces

sessions.title: Codelabs
sessions.description: Ready-to-code kiosks that allow you to try out the latest and greatest Google technologies. You'll have over 50 hands-on, self-paced tutorials to choose from on the following topics: Accessibility, Ads, Android, Android Devices, Assistant, Firebase, IoT, Location & Maps, Machine Learning & AI, Flutter, Mobile Web, Play, Virtual Reality. Googlers will be around to help out as needed.

sessions.title: Google Play Awards
sessions.description: The Google Play Awards are back with several new categories building off the excitement from last year's inaugural event. Join us as we recognize top app and game developers from around the world who lead the way in delighting users with incredible experiences on Android. If you can't make it in person, tune in to the live stream.

sessions.title: Sandbox Demo: Daydream and Tango
sessions.description:
Go hands-on with Daydream and Tango, our platforms for high-quality mobile virtual reality and augmented reality. Get a preview of the apps, games, and developer tools we're demoing at https://g.co/vr/io17apps

Note: Demo time slots are reservable on a first-come, first-served basis each day beginning 11:30AM on Day 1, and 8:30AM on Days 2 and 3. Come to Dome F early to reserve your demo time slot.

sessions.title: Learn Web Security with Google
sessions.description: Every year we warn close to a million webmasters about their sites being hacked. As a developer, knowing security best practices to defend your site against hacking is essential. In this talk, we'll cover common attack vectors and teach you how to protect your users, reputation, and data. Finally, we'll introduce you to a new security course that provides hands-on exercises and concise lectures on topics covering both attack and defense.

sessions.title: Data Pipelines with Firebase and Google Cloud
sessions.description: From updating a leaderboard to flying a rocket, apps of all sizes need data pipelines. How do you know which tools to use to process all this data? With many different powerful and mature tools like Cloud Functions, Cloud Dataflow, and Firebase Queue it can be confusing to know where to start. We'll dive into each of these tools so you'll be able to confidently choose the solution that's right for your app and business - even as it grows!

sessions.title: Building for Your Next Billion Users
sessions.description: New internet users are coming online around the world and are facing very different constraints to accessing the internet. In this talk, we'll cover what we've learned from building experiences for new internet users and walk through how you can build great experiences that work well for billions of users around the world.

sessions.title: WomenTechmakers.com - A Progressive Web App Migration
sessions.description:
Journey along with Google employee Ewa Gasperowicz, as she walks you through the steps she and her team took to turn the existing WomenTechmakers.com site into a progressive web app.
As part of that journey, Jeff Posnick will introduce a new set of service worker libraries that help power the offline-first, fast experience, and explain how you can effectively use them in your own progressive web app.

sessions.title: Codelabs
sessions.description: Ready-to-code kiosks that allow you to try out the latest and greatest Google technologies. You'll have over 50 hands-on, self-paced tutorials to choose from on the following topics: Accessibility, Ads, Android, Android Devices, Assistant, Firebase, IoT, Location & Maps, Machine Learning & AI, Flutter, Mobile Web, Play, Virtual Reality. Googlers will be around to help out as needed.

sessions.description: Get 1:1 feedback on your projects from Google designers. Note: Design reviews are reservable on a first-come, first-served basis starting at 11:30AM on Day 1, and 8:30AM on days 2 & 3. Swing by our dome at the beginning of each day to reserve a time for your review.

sessions.title: Office Hours with Google's Accessibility experts
sessions.description: Have questions about how to improve accessibility on your Website or Android app? Want to create more inclusive experiences for people with disabilities? Want to learn how to design, develop and test for everyone? Come have a chat with Android and Web accessibility experts

sessions.title: Using Google Cloud, TensorFlow, and the Google Assistant on Android Things
sessions.description: This talk will cover the integration of Google services on Android Things. We will discuss Google Cloud and TensorFlow for machine learning and computer vision, as well as integrating the Google Assistant.

sessions.title: Office Hours: Cloud Big Data, Analytics, and Machine Learning
sessions.description: Have questions about Google Cloud's machine learning, big data, or analytics products and APIs? Want to try out some of the APIs in your application? Members of the Cloud Developer Relations team who know these products well will be available to answer your questions.

sessions.title: Office Hours with the Material Components (MDC) for Android, Web and iOS team
sessions.description: Have questions about creating a reliable development workflow for building beautiful and functional projects? Want help integrating Material Design Components into your Android, iOS, or Web product? Interested in learning about the ins and outs of executing the Material Design Guidelines? Come have a chat with our cross-platform experts on Material Design and Material Design Components.

sessions.title: App Reviews: App Consultations
sessions.description: Meet with Google Play experts to get personalized advice on improving your app performance.

sessions.title: App Reviews: App Consultations
sessions.description: Meet with Google Play experts to get personalized advice on improving your app performance.

sessions.title: Boost User Retention with Behavioral Insights
sessions.description: Discover how developers are successfully applying behavioral economic principles and techniques inspired by games to create more engaging app experiences. In this session, we'll tackle the basics of behavior change and best practices to reward and retain your users. You'll also hear from the CEO of The Fabulous, an app that applies behavioral economic principles to encourage people to reprogram their lives with better habits.

sessions.title: Navigating Google Cloud Platform: a guide for new GCP users
sessions.description: Building great solutions requires you to know your tools. Coming from your own infrastructure or another cloud provider you might have trouble locating all of the tools at your disposal on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Common questions: How do I get a Virtual Machine? What NoSQL solutions are available? Where do I open a firewall port? This session will take you through our various computing options and engines. We'll walk you through our storage options and help you figure out where your data should go as well as dive deeper into our services and show you can get started with big data and machine learning.

sessions.title: App Reviews: Design reviews

sessions.title: Compiling for the Web with WebAssembly
sessions.description: WebAssembly is a fast, portable, compact, cross-browser binary format for compilation to the Web.  It allows new types of applications and heavy 3D games to run efficiently in browsers. We'll describe what web assembly is, the problems it solves, the low level format and compilation tools available to try it out. In addition, the interfacing between compiled language modules and Javascript is explained.

sessions.title: Office Hours with AMP and Search Teams
sessions.description: Have questions about a particular AMP or a Google search feature? Curious about the best practices for Structured Data? How to make your pages shine on Google Search with rich cards, snippets, and carousels? Or, how to build beautiful and fast AMP pages? Come have a chat with the members of the AMP and Search teams

sessions.title: App Reviews: Design reviews

sessions.description: We're gonna build a thing...live. With an audience. It's gonna be fancy, totally not over the top and web based. You can try and confuse the two by asking difficult questions in the live chat.

sessions.description: If you have questions about using Google App Engine or using Google Cloud Platform with any of our supported languages (Java, Go, Python, .NET, Node.js, PHP, or Ruby) come ask our team. Members of the Cloud Developer Relations team will be available to answer your questions.

sessions.description: Have questions about media playback on Android with ExoPlayer? Want to learn how to customize ExoPlayer for your use case, request a feature or learn about our future plans? Come chat with members of the ExoPlayer team and we'll do our best to answer your questions!

sessions.description: Interested in learning about app growth strategies? Have questions about how to effectively monetize your app? Want to know the best way to calculate LTV? Interested in learning more about AMP ads? Get all your questions answered by app ads product experts during the Mobile Apps Office Hours at Google IO.

sessions.title: Machine Learning APIs by Example
sessions.description: Find out how you can make use of Google's machine learning expertise to power your applications. Google Cloud Platform (GCP) offers five APIs that provide access to pre-trained machine learning models with a single API call: Google Cloud Vision API, Cloud Speech API, Cloud Natural Language API, Cloud Translation API and Cloud Video API. Using these APIs, you can focus on adding new features to your app rather than building and training your own custom models. In this session we'll share an overview of each API and dive into code with some live demos.

sessions.title: Office Hours with the Android Studio team
sessions.description: Do you have questions about your app project in Android Studio? Are you looking for tips on how to speed up your Gradle builds?  Do you want to understand how to use ConstraintLayout to optimize your app layouts? If so, come by and chat with the Android Studio team during our office hours to discuss these topics and more.

sessions.title: Office Hours with the Daydream and Tango Developer teams
sessions.description: Learn how to build high-quality mobile VR and AR apps on Daydream and Tango. Hear best practices directly from members of our Developer teams, and discover our latest developer tools to help you maximize performance and quality on mobile devices. Our team's mission is to "make awesome easy," and to provide developers with a creative platform that lets them focus on building the best possible experiences in VR and AR.

sessions.title: Office Hours with the Daydream and Tango Developer teams
sessions.description: Learn how to build high-quality mobile VR and AR apps on Daydream and Tango. Hear best practices directly from members of our Developer teams, and discover our latest developer tools to help you maximize performance and quality on mobile devices. Our team's mission is to "make awesome easy," and to provide developers with a creative platform that lets them focus on building the best possible experiences in VR and AR.

sessions.title: Office Hours with Android Runtime (ART)
sessions.description: The Android Runtime (ART) employs high-performance compiler and garbage collection technology to give the best runtime and memory usage experience for your Android applications.  During office hours engineers will be available to discuss new developments in ART, such as our new garbage collector, and understand and help you address performance and memory issues.

sessions.title: Best practices to improve sign-in, payments, and forms in your apps
sessions.description: Getting through critical flows such as logins, payments, and other forms can be a huge challenge on mobile devices. In this talk, we'll teach you how to take advantage of APIs like Android Autofill, Google Smart Lock, and Backup and Restore in your apps. We will explore making the following user flows easier for your users: 1) the login and payment experience, 2) seamlessly syncing logins between your website and mobile app, and 3) preventing users from getting locked out when they switch devices.

sessions.title: App Reviews: App Consultations
sessions.description: Meet with Google Play experts to get personalized advice on improving your app performance.

sessions.title: Bringing Device Production to Everyone With Android Things
sessions.description: The launch of Android Things now makes device production for the Internet of Things accessible to everyone. Learn more about how Android Things builds on the Android ecosystem to provide familiar development tools, security updates, and long term support for powerful devices.

sessions.title: Office Hours: Actions on Google: 1:1 Consultations with our VUI Team
sessions.description: Building with voice? Whether you're just starting out or trying to deepen your experience to engage more users, bring your actions to our VUI Lab for 1:1 consults with our experienced team of VUI designers.

sessions.title: Office Hours: Finding success with your apps and games in Western Europe
sessions.description: Interested in distributing your app or game in Western Europe? If so, learn key tips and get your questions answered from Google Play experts from the specific region.

sessions.title: Sandbox Demo: Daydream and Tango
sessions.description:
Go hands-on with Daydream and Tango, our platforms for high-quality mobile virtual reality and augmented reality. Get a preview of the apps, games, and developer tools we're demoing at https://g.co/vr/io17apps

Note: Demo time slots are reservable on a first-come, first-served basis each day beginning 11:30AM on Day 1, and 8:30AM on Days 2 and 3. Come to Dome F early to reserve your demo time slot.

sessions.title: The Ballroom
sessions.description: Take part in the beta version of an ever-changing VR experience made by LCD Soundsystem and their fans, directed by Jonathan Puckey & Moniker in collaboration with the Data Arts Team. You can also just chill out to the disco tunes of Jeffrey Paradise (Poolside) followed by synth-pop duo Holy Ghost !.

speakers.name: Kaz Sato
speakers.bio: Kaz Sato is Staff Developer Advocate at Cloud Platform team, Google Inc. He leads the developer advocacy team for Machine Learning and Data Analytics products, including TensorFlow and BigQuery. Invited to major events including Google Cloud Next '17 SF, Google I/O 2016, Hadoop Summit 2016, Strata+Hadoop World 2016 San Jose and NYC, ODSC East/West 2016 and Google Next 2015 NYC. Kaz also has been leading and supporting developer communities for Google Cloud for over 8 years.

speakers.name: Sam Stern
speakers.bio: Helping developers build great Android apps on Firebase.

speakers.name: Milena Nikolic
speakers.bio: Milena Nikolic is a Software Engineering Manager leading Google Play App Distribution team in London. She has been at Google for over 8 years, working on a number of projects related to Mobile, Search and Android. She is passionate about building happy and productive engineering teams, powerful products and cool technology.

speakers.name: Chris Craik
speakers.bio: Chris Craik works on graphics and UI performance in the Android UI toolkit team. He works to help apps achieve smooth scrolling and animations with optimizations and performance tools.

speakers.name: Ratna Desai
speakers.bio: Ratna Desai is a UX Lead at Google. She leads multi-disciplinary teams across Search, Identity, Maps and Assistant to help define and develop engaging, predictive, assistive experiences for the next generation of Google products and services. Over the course of her career, Ratna has integrated design thinking, design sprints and innovation methods into organizations. She takes a holistic, human-centered approach to business challenges, developing solutions that consider the broader cultural context with the belief that well-designed products can improve and ultimately, transform people's lives.

speakers.name: Josh Gordon
speakers.bio: Josh Gordon is the Developer Advocate for TensorFlow at Google. He loves teaching and has over a decade of Machine Learning experience to share.

speakers.name: Rob Aikins
speakers.bio: Rob Aikins is a Product Manager on the App Ads team focused on app re-engagement. Before Google, Rob was a co-founder at Wynston, an online workforce training platform, where he did product and engineering work. Rob received his MBA from Stanford and a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from University of Maryland College Park.

speakers.name: Fontaine Foxworth
speakers.bio: Fontaine is a Product Manager developing Maps APIs. Before joining the Maps team she launched several mobile app analytics tools on Google Analytics and Firebase. Prior to Google she worked as a Product Manager at ModCloth where she built a mobile website as well as iOS and Android apps.  She has a BS in Civil Engineering from Stanford University.

speakers.name: Robert-Jan Huijsman
speakers.bio: Robert-Jan Huijsman is a Software Engineer working on Google Cloud Functions and Firebase, Google's 'serverless' cloud offerings. Previously he worked on Spanner, Google's state-of-the-art planet-scale database. He joined Google in 2012, after getting a Master's degree in Parallel and Distributed Computer Systems at the VU University in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

speakers.name: Lauren Long
speakers.bio: Lauren is a Software Engineer at Google, working on Cloud Functions for Firebase. Prior to joining Google, Lauren co-founded the storage-on-demand startup Boxit, and was the first Product Manager at wearable tech company Nymi. Lauren has spoken at conferences in US, Canada, and China about entrepreneurship and technology. In her spare time, she enjoys swing dancing and rock climbing.

speakers.name: Isaac Katzenelson
speakers.bio: Isaac is a software engineer working on the Android TV team. At Google he has worked on several Android apps including Fit, Calendar, and Clock. Prior to Google, Isaac worked on new technology adoption at Israel's leading mobile phone operator, building one of the first Internet mobile gateways at Comverse, and networking and printing solutions at Electronics For Imaging. Isaac earned his bachelor's degree in computer science from the Hebrew University at Jerusalem.

speakers.name: Xiaowen Xin
speakers.bio: As the product manager for Android platform security and Pixel security, Xiaowen oversees efforts to make Android the most secure mobile OS and Pixel the most secure phone.  She has almost fifteen years of experience in the tech industry, having worked on both Android and Chrome OS at Google, as well as at a number of startups and other major tech companies like Microsoft and EMC.  Xiaowen earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from MIT.

speakers.name: Oliver Woodman
speakers.bio: Olly leads development of ExoPlayer, an open source media playback library for Android. He played a part in developing both YouTube and Play Movies for Android. Prior to joining Google, Olly completed a Ph.D. at the University of Cambridge.

speakers.name: Marc Stogaitis
speakers.bio: Marc is the tech lead manager of the Android Location and Context Client Team. He and his team work on the Android Fused Location Provider API, Activity Recognition, Geofencing, Network Location Provider, GPS, Sensor Manager and the Android Sensor Hub. Prior to Google, Marc earned a bachelor's degree in Software Engineering from the University of Ottawa.

speakers.name: Clayton Wilkinson
speakers.bio:
Clayton is a developer programs engineer focused on the  games and VR industries.  He works with developers integrating Google APIs into game engines such as Unity and Unreal Engine 4.  He  previously worked as a software engineer for Ariba, where he developed reusable application frameworks. Prior to that, he worked for a variety of startups in the communication and online learning industry.
Clayton earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from Purdue University, and a master's degree in the Management of Technology from the Georgia Institute of Technology.

speakers.name: James Giangola
speakers.bio: A simple and beautiful idea: everyday conversation exhibits systematic design features essential for the creation of successful Voice UIs.  This is James Giangola's disruptive contribution to the VUI industry, a concept he's researched rigorously and promoted globally.  His approach has led to a paradigm shift with significant implications for dialog architecture, prompt design, prosody, who we work with and how, corporate branding, and the design process itself.  James is co-inventor and linguist on the patent 'VUIs with Personality' and co-author of Voice User Interface Design.

speakers.name: Emily Schechter
speakers.bio: Emily Schechter is Product Manager for Chrome Security at Google, where she works on Chrome Security UX and HTTPS adoption on the web. She has previously worked on the Google Safe Browsing and Anti-Malvertising teams to keep Google and web users safe from online threats. Emily has degrees in Computer Engineering and Economics from Dartmouth College.

speakers.name: Megan Lindsay
speakers.bio: Megan is a product manager on Chrome, focusing on WebVR and web browsing while in VR. Prior to Google, Megan was the PM for two of the initial HoloLens apps at Microsoft. Megan earned a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from the University of Calgary.

speakers.name: Alex Geboff
speakers.bio: Alex writes developer docs for Firebase - specifically for Realtime Database, App Indexing, and the iOS SDKs. Before joining Google, Alex wrote docs at Box, VeriSign, and ESET. She also herded projects and managed a team at ProvideCommerce. After getting her bachelor's degree from Stanford University in Palo Alto, Alex started out her career writing riveting advertorial and designing marketing websites at the San Diego Union-Tribune.

speakers.name: Jumana Al Hashal
speakers.bio: Jumana is a product manager at Google where she works on Firebase's Growth prodcuts. Before joining Google she built mobile products at Zillow. Jumana loves helping developers grow their apps and learn from developers what challenges they face in doing so. She enjoys traveling, scuba diving, hoola hooping, and prickly machine learning problems. Jumana holds a master's degree from the University of Washington.

speakers.name: Hyunyoung Song
speakers.bio:
Hyunyoung did her undergrad study in Seoul National University in Computer Science 
 department. She did her graduate study in University of Maryland, College Park, where she specialized in Human Computer Interaction (HCI) and published at conferences such as SIGCHI and UIST. After joining Google, she continued to pursue her interest in HCI in teams such as Chromecast, Google Glass, and recently Android frameworks team. In particular she now works in the Launcher team. As a software engineer at Google, she contributed to java SDKs such as Glass SDK and lately Android SDK.

speakers.name: Justin Barber
speakers.bio: Justin leads the visual design of certain features within the Android operating system and Google Pixel. Before that he freelanced for various clientele including a Grammy winner and New York Times Bestseller; and his work has been published by International designers' Network and HOW Design. Justin graduated from Savannah College of Art and Design with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in graphic design.

speakers.name: Eric  Bidelman
speakers.bio: Eric is a Senior Staff Engineer at Google working with the Chrome team on web projects like Lighthouse, Polymer, web components. He's the author of 'Using the HTML5 Filesystem API' and has led frontend projects like the Google I/O web app (2015-16), Google's Santa tracker, chromestatus.com, and html5rocks.com. Prior to Google, Eric worked as a software engineer at the University of Michigan where he designed rich web applications and APIs for the university's 19 libraries.

speakers.name: Parul Soi
speakers.bio: Parul is a Program Manager on Google's Developer Relations team based out of India. For the past year, she's been working with the Firebase team to expand their outreach efforts. Prior to Google, she worked at a creative agency where she was part of award-winning campaigns.

speakers.name: Oli Lan
speakers.bio: Oli is a senior engineer on the Android Wear team. He leads work on system UI and watch faces, and built the emoji recogniser for Wear. Before joining the Wear team, he worked on G+ Year In Review, Auto Awesome Movies, and Chrome for Android.

speakers.name: Kobi Glick
speakers.bio: Kobi is a Product Manager on Google Play, and is focused on making Play the best app distribution platform for developers. Kobi earned a B.Sc degree in computer science with minor in cognitive science from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

speakers.name: Dominic Preuss
speakers.bio: Dominic is a Product Geek on @GoogleCloud

speakers.name: Kim Paulhamus
speakers.bio: Kim is a software engineer for Google's Identity and Authentication team. She has worked in the security space for six years. Since 2014, she has focused on improving the security of user accounts in Android and Chrome, including through various standardization and open protocol development efforts. Kim received her Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Network Security, from LeTourneau University in Longview, TX.

speakers.name: Agustin Fonts
speakers.bio: Agustin is a product manager on the Android team. He focuses on making apps small, the Android Support Library and because of his last name, he obviously works on fonts. He is also part of the Unicode committee and helped introduce the female professional emoji.

speakers.name: Astrid Weber
speakers.bio:
Astrid Weber is working as Senior User Experience Research Lead at Google in California. She works on accessibility and usability with a focus on hands and eyes free interfaces. Astrid teaches at Stanford's d.school. 
She graduated from the University of the Arts in Berlin with a Master in Design and Communication Research and studied in the bachelor design program of the Art Institute of Chicago.

speakers.name: Patrick Clary
speakers.bio: Patrick is a product manager on the central Accessibility Engineering team at Google where he works to develop services and technology that benefit users with disabilities. Prior to Google, Patrick was a software engineer at Lockheed Martin working on NASA related projects. Patrick earned bachelor's and master's degrees in computer science from the University of Colorado at Boulder, and an MBA with a focus on new product development from Carnegie Mellon.

speakers.name: Felipe Leme
speakers.bio:
Felipe Leme is the lead engineer of the Android Autofill Framework. He joined the Android Framework team in 2015 and worked on many Nougat features such as Data Saver, Interactive Bugreports, and Scoped Directory Access. He's been at Google since 2011, and worked on other Android projects such a as Google Cloud Messaging and Google Play Movies.

Felipe is a passionate TDD (Test-Driven Development) proponent, and co-authored the JUnit in Action, 2nd edition book. He is also a homebrewer and an amateur poker player.

speakers.name: Albert Reynaud
speakers.bio: Albert Reynaud is a Partner Development Manager at Google Play. In his role, he helps Media & Entertainment app developers to find success on Android and Google Play. Prior to joining the Google Play team, Albert worked in business development and sales in various teams at Google such as Product partnerships, Google Affiliate Network and Google Adwords. Albert earned a Bachelor in Management from ESCP Europe Business School and a Master in International Management from Fundao Getlio Vargas in Rio de Janeiro.

speakers.name: Julie Aranda
speakers.bio: Julie is a UX Researcher on the Android team, focusing on ethnographic research.    Prior to joining Google, Julie was a UX Researcher at eBay, Yahoo!, Palm, and LeapFrog. Julie earned a PhD in Psychology from the University of Oregon, and a Bachelor's in Psychology from UC Berkeley.

speakers.name: Stefan Kuhne
speakers.bio: Stefan works as tech lead on the Android window manager integration into ChromeOS. He also worked on Chrome / ChromeOS (UI, multi user, memory management, etc.) and Google Earth before. Prior to Google he developed at miro / Pinnacle / Avid a realtime 3D video effects engine used in different video editors. Stefan earned a Masters degree in computer science from the University of Dortmund, Germany.

speakers.name: Andrew Lewis
speakers.bio: Andrew works on ExoPlayer, an open source media playback library for Android. Previously he worked on automatic movie creation in the Google Photos app. He has a Ph.D. from the University of Cambridge, where he studied forensic signal processing in the Security Group.

speakers.name: George Audi
speakers.bio: George works on Google Play's Business Development team, focusing primarily on helping media and entertainment apps create successful businesses on Google Play. As the lead for the Entertainment vertical, he is heavily involved in subscription-based services, video consumption patterns, and living room initiatives, such as Android TV. Prior to Google, George was a consultant at the Boston Consulting Group (BCG) supporting Fortune 500 clients in the media and technology space tackle complex business problems. George earned a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from the American University of Beirut and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

speakers.name: Kelly Cox-Jorrie
speakers.bio: Kelly is the Global Head of Music Apps BD for Google Play. In this role, Kelly partners with music and audio developers to launch and grow successful app businesses on Android. She has worked with independent music startups as well as the largest publishing companies in the world to help shape product strategy and drive sustainable growth. Kelly holds an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business where she was actively involved with early-stage ventures as a Founder of the Stanford Venture Studio.

speakers.name: Sissie Hsiao
speakers.bio: Sissie Hsiao is the global product leader for Google mobile advertising. Her areas of responsibility include building a global business leading both advertiser and publisher facing components of in-app advertising, as well as leadership on Google's broader cross-device initiatives. Previously, Sissie led all of Google's cross-channel measurement and attribution efforts. Prior to Google, Sissie was a Lead Program Manager at Microsoft, launching multiple versions of Microsoft Office PowerPoint. Sissie has a BS in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from University of California, Berkeley.

speakers.name: David Singleton
speakers.bio: David leads the Android Wear team and has previously worked in Ads, Commerce & Local and the early Mobile team at Google

speakers.name: Maya Ben Ari
speakers.bio: Maya is leading Android Accessibility efforts to make technology usable for everyone. Previously, she led the next generation of the Android Lock Screen and Fingerprint to give users better security without the hassle of entering passwords. Prior to Google, Maya worked for Microsoft as an on-campus representative and helped design their university strategy. Maya is a technology enthusiast and was heavily involved in the Israeli startup community, co-founding two startups. She earned a bachelor's and master's degree in Computer Science from Tel-Aviv University, and an MBA from University of Michigan.

speakers.name: Stephen Fluin
speakers.bio: Stephen is a Developer Advocate on the Angular Team at Google. Stephen works to solve real world problems faced by developers and businesses, and to represent the needs of the community within the Angular team.

speakers.name: Jonathan Gerrish
speakers.bio: Jonathan currently designs and builds developer tools to make Android engineers productive. Before this he worked as a developer on Android applications such as Google Maps and Android Pay. Prior to Google, Jonathan worked at various software companies across South America and Europe. Jonathan earned a bachelor's degree in computer science the University of Newcastle upon Type and a master's degree in software engineering at the Open University.

speakers.name: Varun Kapoor
speakers.bio: Varun is the Tech Lead for Google's Nearby platform. Prior to this, he led the Abuse Prevention platform team at Yahoo!, was a founding member of the Hadoop Ambari project (yeah, he's as surprised as you are at how he got roped in to working on a UI installer) at Hortonworks, and worked on the planet's largest distributed system at YouTube. He promises not to move on to working on the Blockchain until he makes proximate drones self-assimilate using fully-offline P2P quorum protocols.

speakers.name: Jol Kalmanowicz
speakers.bio: Jol is the Product Manager for Google Maps API client platforms including JavaScript, Android, and iOS. Previously he worked on Google Assistant, G+ Suite, and Glass. He has mentored and advised dozens of startups and nonprofits since joining Google, and beforehand he ran two startups doing web business consulting and international arbitrage. Jol graduated as valedictorian in his Bachelor of Commerce & Computer Science class. His long term goals are to modernize education and development systems to support the growth of humanity.

speakers.name: Glen Shires
speakers.bio: Glen Shires is a speech software engineer who led the development of the Google Assistant SDK, the Cloud Speech API and the Chrome Web Speech API. He also chaired the W3C Speech API group and has been granted over a dozen patents. Prior to joining Google in 2010, he led development teams for voice and speech products at Intel, General Magic and Picazo Communications. Glen received his bachelor's and master's degrees in electrical and computer engineering from the University of Wisconsin - Madison, where he developed a speech-recognition engine for his master's thesis.

speakers.name: Wayne Piekarski
speakers.bio: Wayne Piekarski is a Developer Advocate at Google, focusing on the Internet of Things and the Google Assistant. He has worked for 15 years in academia and industry in the areas of wearable computing, outdoor augmented reality, 3D user interfaces, and mobile devices. He works to get developers excited about new technologies through conferences, social media, and training materials. He also works to advocate for developers within Google, ensuring developers have the right tools and information to support their work.

speakers.name: Surma
speakers.bio: Surma is an engineer working with the Chrome team. He likes to cut himself on the bleeding edge, goes full-stack every once in a while and prefers good code over functional one.

speakers.name: Pali Bhat
speakers.bio: Pali Bhat is the Global Head of Payments products. Prior to Google, Pali was a Vice President of Product Management at SAP Labs. He has also been a consultant for McKinsey & Co. Pali has earned an MS in Computer Science from University of Illinois @ Urbana Champaign and an MBA from Duke University.

speakers.name: Jen Tong
speakers.bio: Jen is a Developer Advocate on Cloud at Google. In this role she helps developers build cool stuff on all sorts of platforms. If she's away from her laptop, she's probably skating around a roller derby track, or hanging from aerial silk.

speakers.name: Alex Memering
speakers.bio: Alex is an engineer on the Firebase Hosting team and previously worked on Auth.  He earned his degree in Computer Science and Software Engineering at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology.

speakers.name: David Mitby
speakers.bio: David Mitby leads Google's mobile app advertising and measurement solutions for Google Search, Display, and Google Play. Previously at Google, he was responsible for Google's Display Optimization products, focused on products and tools that help advertisers get the best performance out of the GDN, through automated bidding (Conversion Optimizer, Enhanced CPC), automated targeting (Display Campaign Optimizer), and tools to guide advertiser optimization. Prior to Google, David led mobile speech efforts at Tellme Networks and Microsoft. He has an A.B. in Computer Science from Harvard University. Prior to Google, David led mobile speech efforts at Tellme Networks and Microsoft.  He has an A.B. in Computer Science from Harvard University, and lives with his wife and two children in Mountain View.

speakers.name: Zak Stone
speakers.bio: Zak Stone is the Product Manager for TensorFlow on the Google Brain team. He contributes to product strategy, collaborates with other teams across Google, and enjoys interacting with TensorFlow's vibrant open-source community. Prior to joining Google, Zak founded a mobile-focused deep learning startup that was acquired by Apple. While at Apple, Zak contributed to the on-device face identification technology in iOS 10 and macOS Sierra that was announced at WWDC 2016.

speakers.name: Chris Oryschak
speakers.bio: Chris is product manager for Digits, Fabric's phone number authentication service, and the Fabric mobile app for Android & iOS. Prior to Google, Chris specialized in developer products at Twitter and co-founded Planchat, a platform for social travel planning. He earned a bachelor's degree from the Pamplin College of Business at Virginia Tech.

speakers.name: William Chou
speakers.bio: William is a software engineer working on new dynamic content in the open-source AMP Project. Prior to joining Google, William studied Computer Science at Cornell University and worked in the games industry.

speakers.name: Hans Boehm
speakers.bio: Hans Boehm works primarily on concurrency issues in the Android platform.  He also regularly gets sidetracked to work on arithmetic in the Google Calculator app. He chairs the ISO C++ Concurrency Study Group. Hans is best known as the original primary author of bdwgc, a garbage collector for C. He has published extensively on memory management and concurrent programming. He holds a Ph.D. from Cornell University. He is a former chair of ACM SIGPLAN, and an ACM Fellow.

speakers.name: Jen Fernquist
speakers.bio: Jen leads the UX Research team for Android Wear.  She had previously worked on Material Design and Search at Google. Jen a Masters degree in Computing Science from the University of British Columbia and a Bachelors (Honours) in Computing Science and Math minor from Simon Fraser University.

speakers.name: Sara Robinson
speakers.bio: Sara is a Developer Advocate on Google's Cloud Platform team, focusing on big data and machine learning. She helps developers build awesome apps through demos, online content, and events. Sara has a bachelor's degree in Business and International Studies from Brandeis University. When she's not programming she can be found on a spin bike, listening to the Hamilton soundtrack, or finding the best ice cream in New York.

speakers.name: Duncan Osborn
speakers.bio: Duncan is a product manager on the Google Search team in New York. He was previously based in Paris as product manager for Google Arts & Culture. Prior to Google, he was on the mobile app product team at LinkedIn. Duncan has a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology and a master's degree in business and entrepreneurship at HEC Paris.

speakers.name: Chen Shay
speakers.bio: Chen is a Software Engineer on the AMP Project @ Google. Prior to AMP, Chen worked on Health Search where she built Health Cards for phones with low bandwidth, and implemented Google answers to Health questions. Chen is a Silicon Valley native. She holds a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from UC Santa Barbara and a Master's degree in Computer Science from Ben Gurion University in Israel.

speakers.name: Burgan Shealy
speakers.bio: Burgan is a UX Design Lead working on tools to make Googlers happier and more productive. She is passionate about spreading design thinking and sprint methodologies to the non-profit community, running design sprints with numerous large non-profits. Prior to Google, she worked at IBM, where she took on design challenges in health, government, energy and retail. She also spent time working for a non-profit based in Gulu, Uganda. Burgan received her MS in International Development from NYU and a BA in Graphic Design from UGA.

speakers.name: David Schairer
speakers.bio: David is responsible for the Home Automation/IoT features in the Google Assistant. Before joining Google two years ago, David founded or advised multiple startups in the AI, NLU, and productivity spaces, including Trapit and Magneto.  He began his career in the ISP and telco business, building Internet infrastructure at Concentric and XO. David has a BA in Latin, Greek, and Classical Archaeology from the University of Michigan, and collects obscure dead languages.

speakers.name: Selim Cinek
speakers.bio: Selim works on the Android system as a senior software engineer. His main focus are notifications, where he's responsible for their visual display. Prior to Google he was a founder of the startup Bitspin which was acquired by Google in 2014. He functioned as an engineer and the lead designer of the app Timely Alarm Clock that was awarded multiple times for its polish and design. Selim earned a Bachelor's degree in computer science at the Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich, Switzerland.

speakers.name: Nandini Stocker
speakers.bio: As a member of Google's Conversation Design standards team, Nandini has created voice experiences for Google's 50+ business units, in 60+ languages and 120+ countries. She is passionate about helping people find help and making voice interfaces more accessible. Nandini also believes the secret to realizing our potential for speech technology in human-to-computer interactions is by honoring the core, evolved rules of human-to-human communication.

speakers.name: Hak Matsuda
speakers.bio:
Hak has been working on game technology on Android for past 4 years.
Prior to Google, Hak worked for multiple platform teams including iOS/macOS, Xbox360, original Xbox, Dreamcast and Genesis.

speakers.name: Ewa Gasperowicz
speakers.bio: Ewa is a Developer Programs Engineer at Google. A frontend engineer, focused mainly on Progressive Web Apps development and analysis, always keen to investigate common scenarios and emerging app design patterns. Also a mentor and a long-standing Women Techmaker initiative supporter.

speakers.name: Jeffrey Posnick
speakers.bio: Jeff is a member of Google's Web Developer Relations team, based in NYC. He writes libraries that take the work out of using service workers, and believes that Progressive Web Apps are the Best Web Apps.

speakers.name: Kirill Grouchnikov
speakers.bio: Kirill is an engineer on the Android UI toolkit team at Google. Before joining the Android team in 2009, he has worked with a variety of UI toolkits and libraries that spanned Motif, MFC, VB, Ada, Delphi, Swing and SWT.

speakers.name: Ilya Gelfenbeyn
speakers.bio: Ilya leads API.AI product development and strategy as its product manager. Ilya co-founded API.AI and served as its CEO before Google acquired the company in September 2016. Prior to API.AI, Ilya co-founded and led several startups and also worked on research projects in natural language understanding and conversational UX areas, where he holds several patents. Ilya earned a bachelor's degree in mathematics from Novosibirsk State University in Russia and an MBA from the University of Brighton in the UK.

speakers.name: Alan Viverette
speakers.bio: Alan Viverette is a Software Engineer at Google on the Android UI Toolkit team. In addition to his work on the core framework, he is Technical Lead for the Support Library project and teaches UX classes within Google.

speakers.name: Malte Ubl
speakers.bio: Malte is a creator and tech lead of AMP. He is also a curator of JSConf EU.

speakers.name: Chris Ramsdale
speakers.bio: Chris Ramsdale is the lead Product Manager for the Google Assistant SDK where he is focused on bringing the Google Assistant experience to the broad ecosystem of third party devices. Prior to the Google Assistant gig he led product efforts for Google App Engine. While over 20+ years building developer tools and platforms, one thing remains the same for him: great developer experiences are absolutely key to success.

speakers.name: Jonathan Karmel
speakers.bio: Jonathan is a Senior Product Manager focused on the end-to-end developer experience for Android Instant Apps. Previously, Jonathan was the PM Lead for Analytics, Data Science, and CRM at Google Play, overseeing the data infrastructure, analysis, and experimentation for Google Play's storefront and digital offerings. Jonathan holds a Bachelor of Science in Statistics and Finance and an MBA in Customer Analytics, both from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

speakers.name: Brandon Jones
speakers.bio: Brandon is a spec editor for the WebVR API and Software Engineer on Google Chrome.

speakers.name: Varouj Chitilian
speakers.bio:
Varouj Chitilian heads engineering for Google's consumer payment products.  He has been an engineer at Google for over 10 years holding various positions in the Ads and Commerce organization. 
Varouj holds MEng and BSc degrees in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from MIT.

speakers.name: Fergus Hurley
speakers.bio: Fergus is a Product Manager on Google Play responsible for improving the experience of Android users around the world. Previously he worked in Google Research on the Assistant and Waze Carpool. Prior to Google he founded & sold a mobile app startup in Silicon Valley. He has a Masters from MIT in EECS and a Bachelors in EE from UCC, Ireland.

speakers.name: Griff Hazen
speakers.bio: Griff is an engineer and technical lead on the Android Wear project, with a focus on the Android Wear SDK. He previously worked on Google+ and Google Groups. Griff earned a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from the University of Washington with a research interest in robotics.

speakers.name: Jenny Gove
speakers.bio: Jenny Gove is a User Experience Researcher at Google, where she studies the use of mobile devices. Currently Managing an Ads UX research team, she has also managed the Apps research team in her 10 years at Google. Previously she held UX roles at Sun Microsystems and startup, Zadu. In her spare time Jenny mentors for 500 Startups. Jenny started her career in academia, as a Lecturer at the Open University, UK. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Southampton in the UK.

speakers.name: Ankur Kotwal
speakers.bio: Ankur leads the Google Maps Developer Relations team, championing the developer experience in the Google Maps APIs and inspiring developers towards the Google developer platform. Ankur is also a founding member and product manager for Google Santa Tracker on Android, an annual tradition focusing on bringing holiday joy.

speakers.name: Yao Chen
speakers.bio: Yao Chen is a Software Engineer working on Android Auto Embedded. She primarily focuses on Android Auto Embedded framework and Google Assistance integration in the car. Yao studied Computer Science at Zhejiang University and Stony Brook University.

speakers.name: Renato Mangini Dias
speakers.bio: Renato is the Developer Relations tech lead for Google IoT platforms. He has been at Google for 5 years, previously working on products like Chrome and Android Auto. He is now focused on making Android Things a great developer platform for IoT. Before joining Google, he co-founded a couple of startups, worked with natural language applied research and even "coached" a Brazilian robot soccer team, despite not playing soccer.

speakers.name: Dan Schlosser
speakers.bio: Dan drives a seamless developer experience across the Firebase console, website, and documentation. Previously, he worked at Facebook, Venmo, and co-founded Minimill, a design agency for branding, web, and mobile. Dan graduated from Columbia University with a bachelor's of science in Computer Science, with focuses on systems programming, human-centered design, and music.

speakers.name: James Lau
speakers.bio: James is a product manager on the Android Studio team. He works on the build system and other tools in Android Studio. Prior to joining Google, he was a Lead PM at Microsoft where he spent over 10 years working on various developer-focused products. James graduated from the University of Waterloo with a Bachelor of Applied Science degree in Computer Engineering, and he also holds a Master of Engineering Management degree from Dartmouth College.

speakers.name: Serge Kassardjian
speakers.bio: Serge Kassardjian is the Global Head of Media Apps for Google Play and Android. He currently leads global business development efforts with Media companies including Entertainment, Video, Sports, News, Virtual Reality and Cable verticals. He was on the launch team for Daydream Virtual Reality, Android TV and various Nexus devices. He formerly worked on incubation businesses in Google's GeoCommerce division, focused on Payments and Offers and was a member of the original Google Wallet launch team doing merchant partnerships. He also was a Venture Capital Investor at Globespan Capital Partners and Corporate Development Director in Sony Music's Global Digital Business. He started his career as an investment banker at Morgan Stanley. He received his MBA from Harvard and Bachelors and Masters in Engineering from Stanford.

speakers.name: Jennifer Holland
speakers.bio: Jen Holland is a program manager Google Classroom and Expeditions, products that aim to transform how teaching and learning happen in the classroom. She leads efforts to bring Expeditions to schools all over the globe through the Pioneer Program, and is responsible for all Expeditions content creation.

speakers.name: Martin Wicke
speakers.bio: Martin Wicke works on TensorFlow's high-level APIs. He joined Google before the TensorFlow launch, after founding a startup doing machine learning for code synthesis. In a former life he was an academic and worked on physics simulation and computer graphics.

speakers.name: Mai Lowe
speakers.bio: Mai is a Product Manager focusing on app analytics.  She has worked on features ranging from install attribution to remarketing, to integrating our app analytics solution with other products at Google.  Prior to her current work, she was immersed in business analytics, having driven growth strategy at places like Teach For America.  Mai earned her BA from Cornell University and an MPP with an emphasis in Statistics and Quantitative Analysis from UCLA.

speakers.name: Thomas Bouldin
speakers.bio: Thomas is the Tech Lead of Cloud Functions for Firebase. Before Cloud Functions, Thomas contributed to the Firebase Realtime Database, backend reliability, and Firebase SDKs. Before Firebase, Thomas was an early engineer at Parse. He had a hand in many Parse products and is best known as the lead developer for Parse Push. Previously Thomas was an engineer on Google's Image Search infrastructure and Microsoft Windows. Thomas Earned his bachelor's degree in software engineering at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo with a focus on computer graphics and operating systems & security.

speakers.name: Lukas Bergstrom
speakers.bio: Lukas is a product manager for Android developer frameworks. He was previously product manager for Google Tag  Manager, and before Google at CrowdFlower. He has held roles as a software engineer, management consultant and program manager for organizations including Monitor Group (now Monitor Deloitte) and One Acre Fund.

speakers.name: Yulong Liu
speakers.bio: Yulong develops Mobile Vision API as a software engineer at Google Research. Yulong has a Master's degree from Tsinghua University, where he published 7 papers in computer vision field and graduated with honors.

speakers.name: Darren Delaye
speakers.bio: Darren is the User Experience Lead and Design Manager for the Daydream VR platform team. He was previously the lead designer for Google Maps where he created the Google Maps app for iOS, and before that he was the original designer on Google Docs. Darren studied Computer Science and Human Computer Interaction at Stanford.

speakers.name: Rachel Garb
speakers.bio: Rachel leads a UX team of designers, researchers, and writers responsible for Android's operating system on phones, including Pixel. She's also the author of the Material Design guidelines for Android Notifications. Prior to joining Google in 2005, she was a designer at TiVo, a producer at AOL, and a technical writer at IBM. Rachel earned a master's degree in Educational Technology from Harvard University, and a bachelor's degree in Technical Writing from Carnegie Mellon University.

speakers.name: Addy Osmani
speakers.bio: DevRel Engineering manager working on Chrome at Google. Lover of web and Progressive Web App tooling. Creator of Yeoman, TodoMVC, Critical and Material Design Lite.

speakers.name: Chris Raynor
speakers.bio: Chris joined Firebase in 2013 as employee 11. He is the author of Firebase Queue and currently leads infrastructure for Firebase Hosting. Chris cut his teeth at startups, where he managed large-scale data processing pipelines. He holds a bachelor's in Mechanical Engineering and a master's in Advanced Engineering from the University of Warwick in the United Kingdom.

speakers.name: Sumier Phalake
speakers.bio: Sumier is a UX Design Lead at Google working on products designed to improve the lives of the Next Billion Users. Prior to Google, he worked at IBM, where he took on design challenges in the media, entertainment, sports and retail industries. Sumier has spent considerable time working with non-profits and is passionate about applying design sprints and design thinking to solve their challenges. Recently he spoke at IXDA '16 talking about his experiences working with NGOs in Nepal after the earthquake. Sumier received his MS in Digital Media from GeorgiaTech.

speakers.name: Valerie Nygaard
speakers.bio: Valerie leads the consumer experience product team for Actions on Google. She's worked on search and NLP in Silicon Valley for over 15 years, with stints in research, engineering, business and product. She's been employee #2 and employee #44,674 (or so). Big company or small, her product philosophy is the same -- she tries hard to make things easy.

speakers.name: Patrik Torstensson
speakers.bio: Patrik is the one of the engineering leads for Android low-ram efforts.

speakers.name: Tim Murray
speakers.bio: Tim runs the Android performance team at Google. Prior to his time at Google, he worked on high-performance computing at NVIDIA.

speakers.name: Paul Bakaus
speakers.bio: Paul Bakaus is a Developer Advocate at Google, heading up outreach for AMP. He assists developers, designers, and filmmakers to create better, faster, more immersive and more convincing digital experiences. Prior to joining Google, he created the popular UI library jQuery UI, and later the Aves Engine, the first interactive HTML5 game engine - which he ultimately sold to Zynga.

speakers.name: Fiona Yeung
speakers.bio: Fiona is an interaction designer on Google's Material Design team. She is passionate about designing the future and helping the UX community through design outreach and diversity efforts. On the side, she manages XX+UX, an organization celebrating and empowering women in UX through mentorship and community events. Fiona earned a Bachelor's degree in Design with an emphasis on graphic and UX design from York University & Sheridan College in Toronto.

speakers.name: Krista Seiden
speakers.bio: Krista Seiden is currently a Product Manager for Firebase Analytics. Previously, she was the Analytics Advocate for Google. Prior to this, Krista drove analytics and optimization at the Apollo Group and Adobe. She holds a B.A. in Economics and Political Science from the University of California, Berkeley and a marketing certification from the Wharton Business School. You can follow her blog at www.kristaseiden.com and on twitter @kristaseiden.

speakers.name: Luiz Gustavo Martins
speakers.bio: Gus is a Software Engineer with 15 years of experience. Works at Google, helping Firebase developers' apps getting even better.

speakers.name: Kai Haley
speakers.bio: Kai Haley is a UX designer leading the Design Relations team at Google. She is one of the lead trainers for Sprint Master Academy and has spent the last 2 years training over 200 Sprint Masters across Google's diverse product areas. She is passionate about design thinking and inspiring the UX community to effectively utilize Design Sprints for speed and innovation. Her UX expertise has been centered on creating monetization opportunities, most recently on the Search Ads Team, and prior to Google, on the Yahoo! Front Page. She earned a Masters Degree in Design from CCA, where she focused on sustainable design.

speakers.name: Daniel Padgett
speakers.bio: Daniel is a Conversation Design Lead for Google Assistant, creating engaging and effortless user experiences for Home, Pixel, Wear, and more. For the past 15 years, he has been leveraging language technologies to develop user-centered solutions for major brands like Allstate, Nike, Target, and Cisco. Just prior to Google, he led service design efforts as Director of Customer Service Experience at Walgreens, deploying connected and personalized contact solutions for roughly 100 million customers at more than 8200 stores. Daniel earned a Bachelor of Arts in English and Creative Writing from North Central College in Illinois.

speakers.name: Emily Shack
speakers.bio: Emily has been a software engineer at Google for a little under two years. She is an expert on the Flutter framework, and is passionate about exploring the intersection between machine learning and user interface design. She received her bachelor's degree in computer science from Carleton College in Northfield, Minnesota.

speakers.name: Hadi Hariri
speakers.bio: Developer and creator of many things OSS, his passions includes Web Development and Software Architecture. Has authored a couple of books, a few courses and has been speaking at industry events for over 15 years. Currently at JetBrains leading the Developer Advocacy team. Spends as much time as he can writing code.

speakers.name: Dan Sandler
speakers.bio: Dan leads the Android System UI engineering team, which is responsible for pretty much everything you see on the Android screen that isn't an app. Before Google he was a grad student researching distributed systems and security. And even before that, he worked at Palm and Be on the UI of their respective operating systems. Dan has a Ph.D in computer science from Rice University.

speakers.name: Souvik Sen
speakers.bio: Souvik is a Software Engineer in Android. Prior to Google, Souvik was a Research Scientist systems in Hewlett Packard Labs specializing in location systems and wireless networks. Souvik earned his PhD in Computer Science from Duke University.

speakers.name: Hsiu Wang
speakers.bio: Hsiu is a software engineer in the Mobile Vision team, which focuses on bringing the latest computer vision research to developers. Prior to joining the MV team, Hsiu worked at Niantic Labs. Hsiu helped develop Pokemon Go, Ingress, and Field Trip.

speakers.name: Sami Ben Hassine
speakers.bio: Sami is the CEO of Fabulous, the app that guides you in developing and reinforcing new, healthy habits. Fabulous has received the Material Design award and was a nominee for the Most Innovative App category in the Google Play Awards. For the past three years, Sami has been applying behavioral economics principles to create better apps as part of the Center for Advanced Hindsight at Duke University.

speakers.name: Shai Barack
speakers.bio: Shai works on Google's frameworks and infrastructure for Android app developers, making sure that the tools are working for the engineer and not the other way around. Previously, Shai built distributed software systems to help run Google's massive internal data center network. A strange thought possessed him that mobile might be something that's worth looking into, and a few years later, here we are. Shai is a bachelor of computer science & electrical engineering from Tel Aviv University.

speakers.name: Vamsee Jasti
speakers.bio: Vamsee Jasti is a product manager on AMP. His mission is to fix the biggest offender of performance on the web - ads.

speakers.name: Indranil Chakraborty
speakers.bio: Indranil is a Product Manager on the Google Cloud Platform team. Most recently, he held product management roles at Google Fiber where he led the pricing and launches of the Fiber TV packages, and the development of the cloud infrastructure for their TV product. Prior to Fiber, Indranil was a Senior Manager of SMB sales for Google AdWords, and ran revenue programs which grew to generate $300M+ in incremental annual revenue. Indranil holds an MBA from UCLA Anderson, and a Bachelor of Engineering from VJTI, Mumbai.

speakers.name: Nicolas Roard
speakers.bio: Nicolas worked over the years on various projects at Google, from the HTML5 support in Android Browser, implementing the webview hardware acceleration in Honeycomb, or writing a scalable and non-destructive photo editor in JB/KitKat. After a year building high-speed telemetry systems for robots, he came back to Android, created ConstraintLayout and now works on the Android Studio layout editor.

speakers.name: Doris Liu
speakers.bio: Doris is an engineer working on the Android UI ToolKit team. Her primary focus is improving and expanding animation on Android, with the intention to reduce jank. She is responsible for physics-based animation library, Animator Framework, and AnimatedVectorDrawable.

speakers.name: Romain Guy
speakers.bio: Romain leads the Android Graphics team at Google, which delivers the surface compositor, OpenGL ES, Vulkan and other low-level graphics layers to Android devices. Romain was previously on the Android framework team where he spent years working on the UI toolkit and hardware accelerated rendering pipeline.

speakers.name: Chiara Chiappini
speakers.bio: Chiara is a Developer Advocate at Google in the Developer Relations Team. She helps partners be more successful on the web, on Android and iOS. Prior to Google, she was a full stack engineer at eBay. Chiara has a MSC in Computer Engineering from Alma Mater University of Bologna, where she graduated with honors.

speakers.name: Suzanne van Tienen
speakers.bio: Suzanne is a Product Manager on Google Play, focusing on bringing Android app health and performance insights to the next level. Suzanne holds an MSc in Computational Linguistics from the University of Amsterdam in the Netherlands. Before joining Google, she worked on a variety of technologies including machine translation, natural language search, device targeting and mobile analytics.

speakers.name: Archita Vadali
speakers.bio: Archita Vadali is a software engineer working on Google Assistant.  She has worked at Google for over 6 years, covering a variety of internal and external products. Archita earned a Master's degree in Computer Science from University of Texas at Dallas.

speakers.name: Jake Wharton
speakers.bio: Jake is an Android engineer at Square working on the Square Cash app. He works with a small team to build focused open source libraries like Retrofit, OkHttp, and others which are the foundations on which Square's Android apps are built.

speakers.name: Victor Tsaran
speakers.bio: Victor works on the Android Accessibility Services team as a Technical Program Manager, focusing on the TalkBack screen reader and other accessibility features in the Android ecosystem. He previously contributed to accessibility efforts for Google+, Photos, Hangouts and other social initiatives at Google. Prior to Google, Victor led accessibility teams at such companies as PayPal and yahoo!, and has extensively travelled in South East Asia teaching computers to visually impaired students and trainers. He received a Bachelor's degree in computer science from Temple University in Philadelphia, PA.

speakers.name: Doug Stevenson
speakers.bio: Doug is a veteran engineer, experienced public speaker, and developer advocate at Google with the Firebase team.  He's been developing for Android since the very first Android device was on the market, and has bootstrapped the efforts of silicon valley startups.  Outside of work, Doug follows professional ice hockey and enjoys craft beer.

speakers.name: Purnima Kochikar
speakers.bio: Purnima Kochikar is the Global Head of Apps and Games business development at Google Play where she oversees all aspects of the app ecosystem including strategy, operations, partnership management, technical support and developer marketing. Prior to Google, Purnima held various roles at Nokia including leading developer activities worldwide, which took her to more than 30 countries working on initiatives as diverse as building mobile education centers in Africa, tech incubators in Singapore, Bangalore and Tel Aviv, and launching mobile apps to solve some of the most fundamental human problems including education, healthcare, and supply chain management for food and medicines. She serves on the board of SVForum, which focuses on fostering entrepreneurship through education and mentorship.

speakers.name: Garen Checkley
speakers.bio: Garen Checkley evangelizes product design methods for new internet users to UX, product, engineering, and marketing teams across Google. He previous led the design of the first version of YouTube Go, a new app designed and built specifically for the next billion users, and co-founded YouTube's Emerging Markets initiative.

speakers.name: Christina Lee
speakers.bio: Christina is an Android engineer at Pinterest, where she works on the Core Product team. She spends most of her time evaluating how tools, languages, and architectures can be leveraged to enhance code quality and developer velocity.

speakers.name: Andre Valente
speakers.bio: Andre manages a number of development programs in Google Search, particularly focused on structured data. Prior to Google, Andre founded software start-up companies, and managed software engineering for businesses in the software, manufacturing and aerospace. He also worked as a research scientist at the University of Southern California. Andre received a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Amsterdam and an MBA from the University of Southern California. He has published more than 70 technical articles on areas such as AI and e-learning.

speakers.name: Duke Dukellis
speakers.bio: John 'Duke' Dukellis is a Group Product Manager at Google, where he leads mobile app advertising products for developers and publishers.  Prior to Google, Duke led the Consumer Wallet and Consumer Financial Services teams at PayPal.  Earlier was CEO at StepNexus, a global chip security company acquired by Gemalto.  He received his B.S. in Computer Science, B.S. in Management Science, and Masters in Computer Science from MIT.  He holds an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and is a CFA charterholder.

speakers.name: James Smith
speakers.bio: James is a Product Manager on Google Play. James has a PhD and bachelor's degree in Computer Science from the University of St Andrews in Scotland.

speakers.name: Tor Norbye
speakers.bio: Tor Norbye is the tech lead for Android Studio, and has worked on many of the features in the IDE (and is also the author of Android Lint.) Prior to joining Google in 2010, he worked for 14 years at Sun Microsystems. He has a master's degree in Computer Science from Stanford University.

speakers.name: Ben Schrom
speakers.bio: Benjamin Schrom is the product manager responsible for Google Expeditions as well as other VR and AR educational initiatives on the Daydream team.

speakers.name: Laurence Moroney
speakers.bio: Laurence Moroney is a Staff Developer Advocate for Google working on Firebase and Google Maps. When not Googling, he's the author of dozens of programming books and several science fiction novels. He's also a regular on the Google Developers YouTube channels and host of the popular show 'Coffee with a Googler'.

speakers.name: Sarah Allen
speakers.bio: Sarah Allen created early web platforms for realtime apps with Shockwave and Flash Media Server.  She led the mobile development company, Blazing Cloud, developing many native mobile and web apps.  She now leads the Cloud for Mobile server engineering as part of the Firebase team at Google.  Sarah believes that software should be seriously fun, and that there is magic is in making powerful tools that spark imagination and challenge us all to keep learning and inventing.

speakers.name: Douglas Eck
speakers.bio: Doug leads Magenta, a Google Brain project working to generate music, video, image and text using deep learning and reinforcement learning. A main goal of Magenta is to better understanding how AI can enable artists and musicians to express themselves in innovative new ways. Before Magenta, Doug led the Google Play Music search and recommendation team. From 2003 to 2010 Doug was faculty at the University of Montreal's MILA Machine Learning lab, where he worked on expressive music performance and automatic tagging of music audio.

speakers.name: Michael Bleigh
speakers.bio: Michael is an engineer on the Firebase team focused on Hosting, the CLI, and the web. Michael has been building open source and developer tools since 2008, and has presented at events including Google I/O, the Chrome Developers Summit, OSCON, and RailsConf.

speakers.name: Devvret Rishi
speakers.bio: Dev Rishi leads product for Firebase Authentication, coordinating the design and implementation of developer tools to managing user identities. Previously, he worked as a product manager on Enterprise Apps within Google, focusing on communication and productivity for business teams. Prior to Google, Dev worked for smaller startups and graduated from Harvard University with a Bachelors and Masters in Computer Science.

speakers.name: Jon Mensing
speakers.bio: Jon is the product manager for Firebase Cloud Messaging & Notifications. Prior to Google, Jon was a product manager at BuzzFeed and Zynga.  He also worked as a technology consultant and U.S. Air Force officer. Jon earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the U.S. Air Force Academy, a Master of Public Policy degree from the Harvard Kennedy School, and an MBA from the Wharton School.

speakers.name: Wei Wang
speakers.bio: Wei is a Software Engineer in Android Location and Context team. He works on Fused Location Provider API. His main focus is reducing battery consumption of location, as well increasing location accuracy. Wei received a master's degree in Information Security from Carnegie Mellon University. Prior to that he earned a master's degree and a bachelor's degree from Southeast University in China.

speakers.name: Wojtek Kalicinski
speakers.bio: Wojtek focuses on Android Studio outreach, working closely with internal teams to make sure we provide the best development environment for Android developers.

speakers.name: Yuan Niu
speakers.bio: Yuan is an anti-abuse researcher who focuses on web security. She strives to help webmasters in securing their websites and cleaning up after a hack. Yuan was a Yahoo! prior to joining Google. She received her PhD in Computer Science from University of California, Davis, and her BA in Computer Science from Wellesley College.

speakers.name: Bill Bilodeau
speakers.bio: Bill Bilodeau helps make mobile game companies successful by working as a Developer Advocate at Google. Prior to Google, he worked at AMD in graphics developer relations. Before that, Bill worked as a game developer at TKO Software and THQ's Pacific Coast Power and Light studio. He has a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from the University of California, Berkeley.

speakers.name: Sridhar  Ramaswamy
speakers.bio:
Sridhar Ramaswamy oversees all of Google's Ads and Commerce products, which include search, display and video advertising, analytics, shopping, payments, and travel. Joining Google as an engineer in 2003, he's been an integral part of the growth of AdWords and Google's advertising business.
Prior to joining Google, Sridhar was a Director of Engineering for the analytics platform at E.piphany. He also held research positions at Bell Labs, Lucent Technologies, and Bell Communications Research (Bellcore). Sridhar earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the Indian Institute of Technology Madras, and his master's of science and PhD in computer science from Brown University. He has published numerous papers on database systems and database theory, and holds several patents in that area.

speakers.name: Jen-Mei Wu
speakers.bio: Jen-Mei Wu is a Software Architect at Indiegogo, where she works on engineering guidelines and architecture for the engineering team. Her current focus is on infrastructure (e.g. cloud hosting), performance, and front-end architecture. She is also one of the organizers of Indiegogo's Diversity and Inclusion group. Jen-Mei is also a founder and organizer of Liberating Ourselves Locally, a social-justice-oriented, people of color-led, and gender diverse maker/hacker space in Oakland.

speakers.name: Niko Schrer
speakers.bio:
"Niko has been working with developers to drive their mobile apps business in different roles at Google for over 5 years. As a partner manager for Google Play, his latest obsession is to help Android developers drive user engagement in apps and he continues to be deeply fascinated by the unique spirit and focus on innovation in the developer community. 

Niko holds a diploma in Media Economics from the University of Applied Sciences in Cologne and is highly passionate about watching and doing all kinds of sports."

speakers.name: Belinda Langner
speakers.bio: Belinda Langner is a Product Manager at Google working on mobile app ads. She is currently focused on improving app install ads as the lead PM on Google's Universal App Campaigns. Previously at Google, Belinda played a key role in launching Search Ads on Play to help users discover apps within the Google Play Store. Prior to Google, she worked as an engineer at IBM. Belinda holds a BS in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon University.

speakers.name: Emily Fortuna
speakers.bio: Emily is a Senior Software Engineer on the Dart programming language team, making Flutter efficient, fast, and easy to use. In her 20% time she works on improving fairness in Machine Learning and raising awareness about unintentional bias in algorithms. Emily is an Anita Borg Scholar, has a Masters in Computer Science from the University of Washington and a Bachelors in both Computer Science and Linguistics from Rice University. When not hacking on computers she can be found acting on the stage or screen.

speakers.name: Nick Korostelev
speakers.bio: Nick Korostelev is a Software Engineer in Test at Google, on a mission to make developers love Android.

speakers.name: Andrew Lee
speakers.bio: Andrew cofounded Firebase in 2011 and served as CTO until Firebase joined Google. He is now an engineering lead for Firebase, focusing on infrastructure products including the Realtime Database, Hosting, Cloud Functions, and Cloud Storage. Andrew lives and works in San Francisco.

speakers.name: Maggie Stanphill
speakers.bio:
Since joining Google in 2011, Maggie has shaped Google products through language. She's developed company-wide UX writing and brand voice guidelines while working on Google Assistant, Maps, Search, Shopping, and Travel. She also co-founded the UX content strategy discipline at Google. After starting out as a newspaper and book editor, Maggie then moved into content strategy at Expedia, Razorfish, MSN, and Nike. She majored in English and creative writing at UW in Seattle 
 - and had no idea then that her Mad Libs-style dialogue brainstorming would someday impact people around the world.

speakers.name: Don Turner
speakers.bio: Don helps developers to achieve the best possible audio experiences on Android. He spends a lot of time tinkering with synthesizers, MIDI controllers and audio workstations. He also has an unwavering love for Drum and Bass music and used to DJ in some of the worst clubs in Nottingham, UK.

speakers.name: David Yang
