speakers.bio: David is a UX engineer who uses Flutter(flutter.io) to bring prototypes and production UIs to life. Prior to Google, David ran product at his startup, Vessel Science. Before that, David was a interaction designer at VMware where he started the UX prototyping team. David graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with a bachelor's degree in Digital Media Design.

speakers.name: Nithya Sambasivan
speakers.bio: Nithya Sambasivan is a user experience researcher on Google's Next Billion Users team and previously at Google Access and Google.org. She works in the area of emerging markets. Nithya has a Ph/D. in Informatics from University of California, Irvine and a MS in Human Computer Interaction from Georgia Tech. Her research has won many awards at CHI and ICTD.

speakers.name: Sam Birch
speakers.bio: Sam is a product manager on the Chrome for Android team, focused on improving Chrome as a platform for web and app developers. He earned a ScB in computer science from Brown University.

speakers.name: Steve Ganem
speakers.bio: Steve is a Product Manager of Firebase Analytics, overseeing developer features and integrations with other Firebase products and services.  Prior to joining Google, Steve spent 19 years in the video game industry, starting with EA and Activision, where he was the lead tools and online engineer for Tony Hawk's Pro Skater.  He went on to found SuperVillain Studios - an independent game studio in Southern California - where he served as CTO and CEO for 11 years.

speakers.name: Owen Campbell-Moore
speakers.bio: Owen is a Product Manager on Chrome's Web Platform team. He focuses on making the web a more powerful platform for Progressive Web App (PWA) developers and ensuring PWA developers are successful and building amazing products.

speakers.name: Philip Walton
speakers.bio: Philip is a senior developer programs engineer working on the web platform. Prior to working at Google, Philip was lead front-end software engineer at AppFolio where he built component libraries and tooling for a variety of different web teams. Philip also has experience working in agencies, with non-profit organizations, and as a freelancer. He earned a bachelor's degree in music composition from Westmont College in Santa Barbara.

speakers.name: Shubhie Panicker
speakers.bio: Shubhie drives web performance efforts as an engineer on the Chrome Web Platform team. She develops web performance metrics and standardized platform APIs. Prior to Chrome, she worked on server infrastructure and web frameworks for products like Google Search, Google Photos etc. Shubhie holds a master's degree from Carnegie Mellon University.

speakers.name: Jared Strawderman
speakers.bio: Jared Strawderman is a Multimodal Design Lead on Google's conversation design team.  He comes from electric car start-up, Lucid Motors, where he was Head of User Experience.  And previously, he led the team who designed the conversational interface for Alexa at Amazon.  Jared has unique experience in shipping multimodal solutions on a broad range of products, including enterprise customer care, medical, automotive, TV, desktop, mobile, and other consumer electronic devices.

speakers.name: Maru Ahues
speakers.bio: Maru is a Developer Advocate on the Google Developer Platform team and is the DevRel lead for Android Instant Apps. She manages the partner engineering teams that work with Google's top partners on new technologies. She also works to advocate for developers within Google to improve their developer experience. When she's not at Google, she loves coding, reading books and playing video games with her kids.

speakers.name: Paul Irish
speakers.bio: Paul Irish is a front-end developer who loves the web. He works on Lighthouse, Chrome DevTools, and performance metrics.

speakers.name: Juliana Appenrodt
speakers.bio: Juliana is a UX writer on the Payments team at Google, where she's been translating technical jargon into user-friendly terms for nearly 3 years. Before discovering her passion for UX, she worked with words as both a marketing and lifestyle writer, contributing pieces about fashion, food, and travel to a variety of print and online publications. She has a degree in journalism from the University of Southern California.

speakers.name: Elie Bursztein
speakers.bio: Elie Bursztein leads Google's anti-abuse research, which helps protect users against Internet threats.  Elie has contributed to applied-cryptography, machine learning for security, malware understanding, and web security; authoring over fifty research papers in the field. Recently he was involved in finding the first SHA-1 collision. Elie is a beret aficionado and performs magic tricks in his spare time. Born in Paris, he received a Ph.D from ENS-cachan in 2008 before working at Stanford University and ultimately joining Google in 2011.

speakers.name: Brandon Wuest
speakers.bio: Brandon Wuest is a software engineer working on Google Expeditions as well as other VR and AR educational initiatives on the Daydream team. Previously, he also led the Google Cardboard and Street View VR efforts.

speakers.name: Robert Nyman
speakers.bio: Robert is a Global Lead for Programs & Initiatives, Web Developer Relations, at Google. He also helps developers in creating great things!

speakers.name: Jerome Dochez
speakers.bio: Jerome has worked on the Gradle Plugin for Android for the last three years. After writing the new manifest merger, he took the technical lead position on the project and oversaw the InstantRun project. Like the rest of the team, he is now focusing on making the build system faster. Before, he was working on the Gmail front end servers as part of the Inbox initiative. In a previous life at Sun Microsystems, Jerome was the GlassFish (Java EE Open Source Server) Architect where he lead the V3 modularity effort. He also worked on the JDK from version 1.0 to 1.3.

speakers.name: Damien Mabin
speakers.bio: Damien is a Developer Advocate for video games, he has been in the video game industry since 2010. Prior to joining Google he worked at Gameloft and Ubisoft. He has a strong background in graphics programming and also a good experience in mobile game monetization. He now helps game developers of all sizes to make great games on Android and is particularly involved in Firebase, Vulkan, automatic testing and NDK.

speakers.name: Oren Jacob
speakers.bio: Before co-founding PullString as CEO, Oren was an Entrepreneur in Residence at August Capital. A filmmaker and technologist, he spent more than 20 years at Pixar, most recently as Chief Technical Officer and Director of the Studio Tools group. His feature film credits include Toy Story and Toy Story 2, A Bug's Life, and Supervising Technical Director for Finding Nemo. Oren also helped found Pixar University and taught animation at the Academy of Art College for seven years. Oren currently teaches "Lean Launchpad" courses with Steve Blank at Stanford, Berkeley, Columbia, and for the NSF.

speakers.name: Khanh LeViet
speakers.bio: Khanh helps developers in Japan and South Korea build better products by advising on the best use of Google technologies and providing 1:1 technical support. He focuses on mobile app technologies, including Firebase, Google Play and Android. Prior to Google, Khanh was an iOS engineer at Recruit. Khanh graduated from The University of Tokyo, majoring in Applied Physics. Fun fact: Khanh loves learning languages. He speaks Vietnamese, Japanese, English and is now learning Korean.

speakers.name: Sarah Thomson
speakers.bio: Sarah is focused on indie partners and building the indie community that fuels innovation, diversity and richness on the Google Play Store. Sarah has been working in games for over 10 years, starting her career with an indie games developer based out of Vancouver, Canada. Before coming to Google, she cut her teeth in the console space building the F2P business vertical over at Sony PlayStation for the past 4 years. Sarah has returned to support her true passion- mobile indies and their awesome games!

speakers.name: Wendy Ginsberg
speakers.bio: Wendy is a Product Manager on the Polymer Project and the Chrome Web Platform team. Previously, she worked on the Google Store, Google's hardware ecommerce site. She joined Google after completing a bachelors degree in Computer Science at Brown University, where she studied Data Science and Humanity Centered Robotics.

speakers.name: Dominic Battr
speakers.bio: Dominic is a Software Engineer, leading the Chrome Privacy and Chrome Web Identity efforts at Google in Munich, Germany. Prior to joining the Chrome team in 2010, Dominic completed a PhD in distributed systems at TU-Berlin, Germany.

speakers.name: Eric Kuan
speakers.bio: Eric is a search outreach specialist currently focused on creating a secure web ecosystem. He also has experience in combating web spam and fraud at Google. Prior to Google, he worked at Bank of America supporting major trading application systems. Eric earned his bachelor's degree at The University of Texas at Austin in Management Information Systems and is a proud Longhorn. Hook 'em!

speakers.name: Josh Lovejoy
speakers.bio: Josh is a UX Designer at Google working at the intersection of Interaction Design, Machine Learning, and unconscious bias awareness. He believes that human-centered design thinking can change the world for the better; that by advocating for the benefits of starting with user need - instead of just technical opportunity - we can build tools that nourish, restore, and augment human capability. Josh works on AI product design and leads a cross-company working group on algorithmic fairness.

speakers.name: Wale Ogunwale
speakers.bio: Wale is the Technical Lead Manager for the Android Windows & Activities team. Him and his team are responsible for several core new experiences on Android including Multi-Display, Picture-In-Picture, and Alert Windows behavioral changes.

speakers.name: Frank van Puffelen
speakers.bio: Frank is an engineer for Firebase at Google. He helps developers build extraordinary apps that use Firebase as their back-end. If you've ever asked a Firebase question on StackOverflow, you've probably met Frank already.

speakers.name: Yigit Boyar
speakers.bio:
Yigit is a software engineer on the Android Framework team focusing on app architecture and developer productivity. He also works on Data Binding and RecyclerView. Prior to joining Google, he was the Android Engineering Manager at Path.
He received his bachelor's degree in computer engineering from Middle East Technical University, Turkey.

speakers.name: Adrian Ludwig
speakers.bio: Adrian Ludwig is Director of Engineering for Android security at Google.  In this role, he is responsible for the security of the Android platform and Google's applications and services for Android. Prior to joining Google, Adrian held technical leadership positions at Joyent, Adobe, Macromedia, @stake, and the United States Department of Defense. Adrian has a BA in Mathematics from Williams College and an MBA from the University of California, Berkeley.

speakers.name: Duke Donghyun Kim
speakers.bio: Duke is currently VP in Netmarble as the Head of Business Development and Marketing Intelligence. For the past 3 years, he structured strong partnerships with conglomerates such as Google, Facebook, and Apple along with strong development studios in Korea. Before Netmarble, we worked in Daum Kakao and led the production of Daum tvPot, the #2 video service used in KR.

speakers.name: Phil Burk
speakers.bio: Phil develops Audio and MIDI APIs as a member of the Android Audio team. Prior to Google, Phil developed game audio system software for 3DO and Sony PS3. His other projects include JSyn, HMSL, various web audio apps, and the ME3000 MIDI Synth firmware. Phil is co-founder of PortAudio. Phil is also working with the MIDI Manufacturers Association on new MIDI standards and serves on their Executive Board.

speakers.name: Clara Bayarri
speakers.bio: Clara is a tech lead on the Android Ui Toolkit team, focused on text, fonts and UI widgets. Most recently, you've seen her work if you set custom fonts or if you interact with the Android text selection toolbar. Clara earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the Polytechnic University of Catalonia and a bachelor's degree in language translation from the Autonomous University of Barcelona.

speakers.name: Jeff Caesar
speakers.bio:
Jeff is a Technical Lead Manager on the Google Assistant team. His team is responsible for transaction APIs and Services, including payments, order lifecycle and user identity.
Jeff joined Google in 2005, and prior to his involvement with Assistant he worked on Adwords, Glass and Search.

speakers.name: Jamal Eason
speakers.bio: Jamal Eason is a product manager for Android developer tools & products at Google. He is responsible for setting the product roadmap and features that help Android developers make great apps.  Prior to Google, he worked on developer tools at Intel, worked as product manager at a mobile app startup, and was a telecommunications officer in the US Army. Jamal earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the US Military Academy (West Point), a master's degree from UMUC, and a MBA from Harvard Business School.

speakers.name: George Mount
speakers.bio: George is a Software Engineer on the Android UI Toolkit team. His work focuses on Android Data Binding and on transition animations, including Fragment transitions. Prior to Google, George was a Software Engineer at Nvidia, Intuit, and Netscape. George received his bachelors in Physics from Oregon State University and masters in Applied Physics from Stanford University.

speakers.name: Dave Burke
speakers.bio: Dave Burke is Vice President of Engineering at Google. He oversees engineering for the Android platform and Pixel software. Prior to joining Google, Dave cofounded and ran a telecoms startup and helped define Web and Internet standards. Dave holds a PhD in Electronic Engineering from University College Dublin, Ireland.

speakers.name: Brian Duff
speakers.bio: Brian Duff leads the Android Context team at Google, and was one of the founding members of the Nearby team. Apart from making devices do cool things when they're near each other, he enjoys singing and playing guitar.

speakers.name: Michael Kleber
speakers.bio: Michael is the Tech Lead for the Publisher Tagging and Ads Latency Team, located in Google's Cambridge, MA office.  Before AMP ads, his greatest hits included moving Google's ad serving to HTTPS and making ad tags into asynchronous scripts.  Prior to Google, Michael worked on speeding up speech recognition, at BBN Technologies, and computational biology, at the Broad Institute.  Before those he was a math professor at Brandeis University and MIT, after earning a math bachelor's degree from Harvard and Ph.D. from UC Berkeley.

speakers.name: Ed Weng
speakers.bio: Edward is a Product Manager of Google's AdMob mobile advertising platform, leading initiatives to bring best-in-class reporting tools to AdMob publishers. Prior to Google, Edward was a full-stack developer at LivingSocial, where he was responsible for the mobile web platform. He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from Princeton University.

speakers.name: John Hoford
speakers.bio: John is a developer on Android. He has worked on Android Studio, RenderScript, Vector Drawables, computed shadows and photo editor filters. Prior to joining Google, John was a principal engineer at GE Healthcare working on their image processing applications framework

speakers.name: Matt Henderson
speakers.bio: Matt leads product management for the Play Developer Console, building publishing, distribution and analytics tools for apps and games developers.  He previously managed the product team for AdWords features, bidding systems and analytics for Shopping Ads.  Matt was the founder and CEO of Rangespan, the retail analytics company acquired by Google in 2014.  He previously worked at Amazon.com, most recently as product director for Amazon's seller marketplace.  Matt studied at London Business School, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and the University of Otago.

speakers.name: Judy Tuan
speakers.bio: Judy is an independent software engineer in San Francisco. In the past, she's volunteered with Railsbridge, led Women Who Code, and mentored at Hackbright Academy. She loves games, constructed languages, singing a cappella, and making transformative change through software.

speakers.name: Dave Smith
speakers.bio: Dave Smith is a Developer Advocate for IoT at Google, focused on providing the best developer experience possible on the Android Things platform. He has worked with the Android stack at all levels, developing custom applications for consumers and system components to run Android on embedded platforms. He loves deep dives, whether through source code or the nearest coral reef.

speakers.name: Sam Beder
speakers.bio: Sam Beder is a product manager on Android Things.  Prior to Android Things, Sam worked on Google Image Search.   Sam earned a bachelor's degree in mathematics and a master's degree in computer science from Stanford University.

speakers.name: Chris McKenzie
speakers.bio: Chris is an interaction and platform designer on the Google VR team. He has also designed for next generation platforms at Creative Lab and Google [x]. Prior to Google, Chris created interactive spaces at The Mill and helped build digital brands at Razorfish. Chris lives in San Francisco with his wife, Amy, and son, Connor.

speakers.name: Preston Jackson
speakers.bio: Preston manages the engineering team developing business analytics and guidance features in the Play Developer Console. Prior to Play, he worked on the SketchUp team with a focus on 3D graphics, mobile, and web products. He started his career working in the High Performance Computing Group at the MIT Lincoln Laboratory. He holds a master's degree in electrical engineering from Brigham Young University.

speakers.name: Brad Abrams
speakers.bio: Brad Abrams is Group Product Manager on Actions on Google -- the platform for the Google Assistant where he is responsible for the developer experiences on the platform. Brad has been at Google since 2011 and has led platform efforts in Google Cloud and Chrome and now on the Cloud Assistant team. Prior to Google, Brad lead many developer efforts at Microsoft on products including the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, Silverlight and Visual Studio. Brad published several books including the bestselling Framework Design Guidelines. Brad has spoken at developer conferences around the world including nearly every major Microsoft developer event during his tenure and many Google IO and GCP Live events since he joined.

speakers.name: Allison Rung
speakers.bio: Allison leads UX content strategy for the Ads Trust & Privacy team at Google. Before Google, Allison completed a Ph.D. thesis in narrative studies at Stanford. Earlier on she studied literature at Amherst College and at the University of Cambridge. She lives in San Francisco.

speakers.name: Ryan Bavetta
speakers.bio: Ryan is a Software Engineer on the Nearby Notifications team. Before Google, he designed mountain bike suspension at Fox Racing Shox, then led a project to identify plant and animal species aided by machine learning. Ryan studied Mechanical Engineering at MIT.

speakers.name: Chet Haase
speakers.bio: Chet leads the Android UI Toolkit team and works on animation, graphics, performance, and UI widgets. He also manages and goes to a lot of meetings.

speakers.name: Nicolas Geoffray
speakers.bio: Nicolas Geoffray is a software engineer working on the ART project. He is responsible for the new optimizing compiler introduced in Android Marshmallow, and its transition to JIT in Android Nougat. Before ART, he helped shape the Dart language and its efficient translation to JavaScript. Nicolas holds a PhD in computer science from the University of Pierre et Marie Curie, Paris, France.

speakers.name: Mark Spates
speakers.bio: Mark is the product lead for Home Automation and IoT capabilities across Google Assistant and Google Home. Mark is also the founder of iotlist.co, a platform for discovering IoT products. Prior to joining Google, Mark was Head of Connected Home Platform at Logitech.

speakers.name: Ali  Abdelhadi
speakers.bio: Ali is a Product Manager on Firebase, and has been a Googler of more than 5 years. He has a background in Biomedical Engineering and Software development. Ali spent a few years working with internet publishers and IT customers on various projects as a consultant before working as a Product Manager. He now helps the new generation of startups build great products using Firebase!

speakers.name: Francois Chollet
speakers.bio: Francois Chollet works on deep learning research and infrastructure at Google Brain and on the Machine Perception team. He is the author of Keras, the deep learning framework.

speakers.name: Arpit Midha
speakers.bio: Arpit leads the initiative within Google to optimize the Android platform and Google Apps for Low RAM devices. Previously, he was a PM on Project Loon, at Google [X]. Arpit earned his MBA from Kellogg School of Management, Masters in Micro-electronics and Bachelors in Electrical Engineering from IIT Bombay.

speakers.name: Brendan Lim
speakers.bio: Brendan is a Product Manager at Google working on Cloud Functions for Firebase, Firebase Hosting, and the Firebase CLI. Before joining Google, he was Product Manager responsible for passenger growth and the passenger experience for both iOS and Android at Lyft. Brendan was also one of the co-founders of Kicksend and is author of two books, "iOS 7 in Action" and "MacRuby in Action".

speakers.name: Vera Tzoneva
speakers.bio: Vera works on Global Product Partnerships for the Google Assistant, and is focused on the platform, Actions on Google. Her team at Google helps developers with integrations on the Assistant, reaching users across Home, Android, Pixel, Wear, and in the future, everywhere the Assistant is. Actions on Google is how developers can launch services like ordering a ride or turning on the lights in the home, and fun things, like finding a new recipe or playing a game.

speakers.name: Alex Danilo
speakers.bio: Alex works with the Chrome team as a Developer Advocate at Google and is co-editor of the HTML5.2 specification at W3C. Prior to Google he worked on W3C web standards for over a decade and developed embedded system software for graphics, text layout and IPTV applications

speakers.name: Tal Oppenheimer
speakers.bio: Tal is a product manager on the Chrome for Android team. Prior to joining the Chrome team, she worked on Google Apps and Local Search. She earned her bachelors degree in Neurobiology with a secondary focus in Computer Science at Harvard.

speakers.name: Nalin Mittal
speakers.bio: Nalin leads App Quality products for Firebase including Test Lab and Crash Reporting. Prior to Google, Nalin co-founded several companies including Appbistro, Appstores.com, Celebrate, and Giffiti where he led product & engineering efforts. Nalin started his career working for Sapient and Pegasystems after earning a bachelor's degree in computer science from Cornell University.

speakers.name: Riccardo Govoni
speakers.bio: Riccardo joined Google over 9 years ago after some time spent pretending to be a physicist. In 2011 he joined the Google Play team, back when it was still known as the Android Market. Today he is one of the engineering leads in Google Play looking after the developer ecosystem, where he helps mobile developers creating great, high quality apps and running successful businesses. When not on Play, he writes short novels in the form of carefully crafted Out-Of-Office messages.

speakers.name: Jeni Fisher
speakers.bio: Jeni is a Google Play business development manager, working with EMEA lifestyle and travel app developers to build sustainable businesses. She previously curated Play store editorial content across apps, games and digital content, following three years building a career in merchandising at Amazon. Jeni earned a bachelor's degree from Cardiff University.

speakers.name: Jeena James
speakers.bio: Jeena James manages Travel & Local partnerships for Google Play with the focus on driving success on the Android platform through product innovation and monetization strategies. She has over 10 years of experience building partnerships at Google. Prior to Google Play, Jeena worked with Partner Business Solutions, Google, leading global efforts on publisher ad-serving and monetization solutions in the US and India. Jeena earned a bachelors degree in Economics, Mathematics and Statistics from St. Xavier's College, Kolkata, India

speakers.name: Melissa Barnhart
speakers.bio: Melissa is a UX Researcher on the Android team, with a focus on Accessibility. Prior to Google, she worked at a London-based start-up, State.com. Melissa earned a master's degree in Urbanization and Development from the London School of Economics.

speakers.name: Terrence Ryan
speakers.bio: Terry Ryan is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform team. He has 15 years of experience working with the web - both front end and back. Before working for technology shops like Google and Adobe he worked in roles that combined development with system administration at the Wharton School of Business. He also wrote Driving Technical Change for Pragmatic Bookshelf, a book that arms technology professionals with the tools to convince reluctant co-workers to adopt new tools and technology.

speakers.name: Zach Koch
speakers.bio: Zach is a product manager on Chrome trying to save the world from annoying checkout forms.

speakers.name: David Sehr
speakers.bio: David leads the ART team in Mountain View.  Before joining the Android team he was the tech lead of Chrome's Native Client team, bringing native code to the web. Prior to coming to Google, he was the architect of the Intel Compiler (icc).  And even longer ago he earned a Ph.D. from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

speakers.name: David Wang
speakers.bio: David is a product manager for transactions on Google Assistant. Prior to Google, he was a vice president of tech infrastructure at Goldman Sachs. David earned an MBA and a dual bachelor's degree in computer science and economics from New York University.

speakers.name: Aga Madurska
speakers.bio: Aga works on the Android Wear System UI team in London, where she leads the Wearable Support Library components effort. She has previously worked on the Android mobile client for Google Maps and is one of the founding engineers of the Cultural Institute mobile platform. Aga holds a first-class MEng degree in Computer Science from Imperial College, London.

speakers.name: Justin Novosad
speakers.bio: Justin Novosad has been a member of the Chrome GPU team since joining Google in 2011. He is the technical lead for canvas APIs in Chrome. Prior to Google, he was a software developer at Autodesk where he has worked on the Maya rendering team, and the image science team. He holds a bachelor's degree in computer engineering and a master's in biomedical engineering from Polytechnique Montral.

speakers.name: Dario Freni
speakers.bio: Dario Freni leads one of the teams that work on Play Developer Console. He focuses on providing clear analytics metrics and app health tools to app developers. Previously, Dario was a tech lead of one of the Ads Site Reliability Engineering teams specializing on fast and reliable large-scale data processing pipelines. Prior to joining Google in 2011, Dario completed his Ph.D. in computer science at Universit degli Studi di Milano (Italy).

speakers.name: Noah Fiedel
speakers.bio: Noah is Tech Lead of TensorFlow Serving, the open source ML serving system running many production models at Google. In his Google career he has helped build the systems powering YouTube, Blogger, Google+ and Hangouts. Prior to Google he's worked on projects as large as Boeing-Jeppesen flight planning software and as small as Color Labs, a 25 person startup he co-founded in the mobile space. Noah holds a BS in EECS from UC Berkeley, is a private pilot and is on a mission to find the best burrito in Silicon Valley.

speakers.name: Adriana Olmos Antillon
speakers.bio: Adriana Olmos is a product designer on The Google Assistant Team, she leads the design effort for third party multimodal interactions. She worked in award winning projects like the '100 Years of the Canadiens'. She was also a design research fellow at the Shared Reality Lab, and the Centre for Interdisciplinary Research in Music Media and Technology (CIRMMT) at McGill University.

speakers.name: Eiji Kitamura
speakers.bio: Eiji is a developer advocate based in Tokyo. He's currently focused on improving developer experience around identity and payment by providing various public talks, documents and learning materials.

speakers.name: Darren Krahn
speakers.bio: Darren currently leads security efforts for IoT platforms. At Google, he has also worked on Chrome OS security. Prior to Google, Darren worked on a variety of security-focused products for companies such as Imation Mobile Security and ActivIdentity. Darren earned a bachelor's degree in Mathematics (Computer Science) from the University of Waterloo.

speakers.name: Anthony Morris
speakers.bio: Anthony is a Software Engineer on the Play team in London. He works on making app downloads more efficient for users. Prior to that, he worked on Google Maps in Sydney.

speakers.name: Aart Bik
speakers.bio: Aart J.C. Bik received his MS degree in computer science (cum laude) from the Utrecht University in 1992 and his PhD degree from the Leiden University in 1996. He was a Principal Engineer at Intel, where he was the lead compiler architect of automatic vectorization in the Intel C++/Fortran compilers. In March 2002, Aart received the Intel Achievement Award (highest company award) for making SSE easy to use through automatic vectorization. In May 2007, Aart moved to Google, where he is currently working on the optimizing compiler for ART (Android Runtime).

speakers.name: Kat Fang
speakers.bio: Kat is one of the software engineers keeping Firebase Storage up and running. She has been part of the Firebase team for 3 years and previously worked on the iOS SDK and backend for the Realtime Database. Kat graduated from MIT with a bachelor's and master's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.

speakers.name: Sammy Wegent
speakers.bio: Sammy is the creator, co-founder, and EmCEO of Speechless, a startup based in San Francisco that produces live comedy shows and learning experiences that use improvisation techniques to make public speaking more fun and less scary. He has a BFA and MFA in Acting and over 15 years as a professional actor, comedian, and instructor. He has performed at comedy clubs, colleges, and corporate events all over the world and has been seen in dozens of TV and web commercials. He has taught acting, writing, improvisation, and stand up comedy at several colleges and companies and has done narrative design and copywriting at various Silicon Valley firms.

speakers.name: Leon Nicholls
speakers.bio: Leon is a Staff Developer Programs Engineer on the Google Developer Relations team, working on assistant and IoT technologies. He is the developer of samples, codelabs, client libraries, documentation and tools for various Google SDK's and API's including Actions on Google, Google Cast, Android Wear, Android TV, Android Auto and Chrome.

speakers.name: Elena Legeros
speakers.bio: Elena Legeros helps publishers build faster digital experiences with Accelerated Mobile Pages. She has held roles in digital marketing and customer operations and started her career marketing books at Penguin Random House. She studied International Relations and Cinema and Media Studies at Wellesley College. In her spare time, she uses her degree traveling and watching movies.

speakers.name: Seth Thompson
speakers.bio: Seth Thompson is a product manager on Chrome, working on the V8 JavaScript engine, WebAssembly, and DevTools. He is passionate about empowering developers with great tools, expressive languages, and productive open source communities.

speakers.name: Mathieu Chartier
speakers.bio: Mathieu Chartier is an engineer working on the Android Run Time. Prior to Google, he obtained a degree in computer science from the University of Waterloo

speakers.name: Mike McDonald
speakers.bio: Mike helps developers build better mobile apps as an iOS engineer and product manager on the Firebase team. Mike has been with Firebase for two years, and has worked at the Omni Group and Texas Instruments. He graduated with a degree in Computer Engineering and Computer Science from Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology.

speakers.name: Justin Broughton
speakers.bio: Justin Broughton has worked at Google for four years on building tools and infrastructure for mobile developers. He is the Tech Lead and Manager for Firebase Test Lab. Prior to this he was VP Engineering at a number of large and small companies, working on building software in diverse areas such as Contact Centers and Health-Gaming. He has previously spoken at Google I/O (2015, 2016), VMWorld (2012), Interactions (2006, 2008) and many other internal and external conferences.

speakers.name: Adam Coimba
speakers.bio: Adam is a Partner Technology Manager for Actions on Google. He supports developers to create great experiences by integrating with the Google Assistant. Adam believes that Actions on Google will be a key ecosystem enabling developers to engage users in new and highly compelling ways. He is focused on creating a great developer experience for Actions on Google with powerful tools like API.AI, to make it fun and rewarding to build for the Assistant.

speakers.name: Chen Xiao
speakers.bio: Chen leads the Assistant in Android Auto team at Google, responsible for building the Google Assistant and voice experience in the car.  With 10+ years of experience at Google, she previously worked on Google Analytics and orkut.  Chen earned a bachelor's and master's degree in Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in Cambridge, MA.

speakers.name: Vikas Gupta
speakers.bio: Vikas leads the engineering team working on seamless authentication efforts in Android. Prior to Android Authentication, he worked on big data analytics platform at Google. Vikas has also worked at Adobe Systems in the past where he built distributed and scalable system for web collaboration solutions. He earned a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from University of Delhi and a masters of science degree from Carnegie Mellon University.

speakers.name: Joe Castorena
speakers.bio: Joe heads app partnerships for Business, Productivity, and Finance; working with developers to build high quality Android apps and successful businesses. He has also worked on global strategy for mobile publisher ad products. Prior to Google, Joe worked in publisher partnerships for AdMob, and Right Media/Yahoo!. Joe earned an MBA with honors from the University of Notre Dame, and a bachelor's degree in business from Trinity University.

speakers.name: Russ Ketchum
speakers.bio: Russ is a Group Product Manager where he acts as the Head of Google Mobile App Measurement and the Head of Google Tag Manager. In addition to his prior work as a product manager on several Google ads products, Russell comes from a startup background where he led product and engineering teams to launch multiple mobile and web apps.

speakers.name: Jungwoo Kim
speakers.bio: After studying GPU hardware architecture and memory sub-system design in university, he joined Samsung Electronics and has worked for 15 years as both hardware and software engineer. With experiences of designing advanced video and image codec hardwares for many SoC projects of research center in early days, he moved to mobile division and has involved in all strategic Galaxy products since 2012. Currently he's leading multiple tech areas like GPU driver, graphics performance, Android graphics framework, GameDev tech support and Khronos standardization.

speakers.name: Andrey Breslav
speakers.bio: Lead Language Designer and Project Lead of Kotlin. Andrey's whole career revolved around language engineering: he started at Borland, then did some academic work on DSLs and generative programming, taught software design and algorithms for a few years, then joined JetBrains in 2010 to co-found Kotlin. Andrey also participates in JCP expert groups working on Java.

speakers.name: Sunny Goyal
speakers.bio: Sunny did his undergrad study in computer science from Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay at Mumbai. After joining Google, he worked as a software engineer on Google Apps for business, Android Translate and android frameworks & system UI, in particular he now works in the Launcher team. Sunny likes to contribute to Android community by pursuing independent app development (e.g. Power Toggles).

speakers.name: Cory O'Connor
speakers.bio: Cory is a Product Manager on the Android TV team focused on delivering rich cinematic 10' living room experiences. In the past at Google he's worked on the Google Fiber and the Google Cloud Platform teams, launching both consumer and enterprise products. In a prior life he tackled fraud & abuse online as a data scientist and built satellites as an aerospace engineer. He holds a Bachelors and a Masters degree in Aerospace Engineering from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo.

speakers.name: Adam Glazier
speakers.bio: Adam Glazier leads UX and sound design across AR/VR projects at Google. While at Google, Adam has been the lead UX designer on Google Earth VR and also helped bring Chromecast from conception to launch. Prior to Google, Adam was at IDEO designing products, services and sounds.

speakers.name: Gerardo Capiel
speakers.bio: Gerardo Capiel is Director of Product Management for Consumer Payments. Prior to Google, Gerardo founded three pioneering companies in the fields of eCRM, social media marketing and SMB omnichannel commerce. He also led engineering at one of Silicon Valley's first purposely nonprofits, focusing on literacy, human rights and the environment.  He's now on their board of directors. Gerardo earned a B.S. from M.I.T. and an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

speakers.name: Monica Dinculescu
speakers.bio: Monica is an emojineer at Google. She works on Polymer, web components and Chrome, and has probably at least once broken the Internet for you. She is unreasonably excited about emoji, wary of web fonts, concerned about web performance and will become your best friend if you bring her cheese. On second thought, she may be a mouse.

speakers.name: Payam Pakzad
speakers.bio: Payam Pakzad is the technical lead for Google Awareness API, a unified sensing platform enabling applications to be aware of multiple aspects of a users context, while managing battery and memory health. Prior to joining Google, Payam had research positions with Qualcomm Research and Digital Fountain, Inc, working on indoor positioning systems, streaming videos, and error correcting codes. Payam has a B.S. from Caltech, and M.S. and Ph.D. from U.C. Berkeley in Electrical Engineering.

speakers.name: Sergei Vasilinetc
speakers.bio: Sergei is a software engineer working on the Android UI Toolkit team. His work focuses on applications architecture and graphics. Prior to Google he worked at SPB Software. He earned his degree from Saint Petersburg State University.

speakers.name: Brahim Elbouchikhi
speakers.bio: Brahim Elbouchikhi is a Senior Product Manager on the Google VR team. Brahim is responsible Daydream's software experience.  Prior to joining the Google VR team, Brahim was a founding PM of the Google Play store where he led monetization, search, and discovery. Brahim holds an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a BS in Computer Science and Engineering from UCLA. Brahim has also worked at Amazon and Deloitte in addition to starting a company in the past.

speakers.name: Justin Fagnani
speakers.bio: Justin is the Technical Lead for Tools on the Polymer project. He has worked on developer tooling since joining Google in 2008, founding the Google App Maker project, and working on Dart tooling before joining Polymer. Prior to Google, Justin was a musician and consultant, helping small and medium businesses build custom customer, fulfillment and warehouse management systems. Justin earned his bachelor's degree in computer science from the University of California, Santa Cruz.

speakers.name: Alex Rickabaugh
speakers.bio: Alex is a member of the Angular core team, working to optimize the platform for the next generation of applications. He works on the Angular service worker as well as server-side rendering and other performance-related features.

speakers.name: Steve Malkos
speakers.bio: Steve Malkos is the Technical Program Manager in the Android Location and Context Group at Google. He manages all engineering aspects for Android's Location and Context programs.  Steve is responsible for defining these initiatives within Google which includes everything from GPS, Fused Location Provider (FLP), Android Sensor Hub, Sensors, and more. Steve  has been involved in the field of location now for over 14 years. Prior to his role at Google, he worked as an Associate Program Management Director at Broadcom, where he managed engineering teams within Broadcom's GNSS software. He holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Purdue University, currently holds 8 patents and has many more pending patents in the field of location.

speakers.name: Larry Yang
speakers.bio: Larry Yang is senior product manager for the Play Commerce seller platform, responsible for helping developers monetize on Google Play. Previously Larry had product responsibilities on Project Tango, Google Fiber and GoogleTV. Larry has been creating innovative consumer products and services for over 20 years, including leading product management for a video conferencing business at Cisco and General Manager of the Xbox 360 console group at Microsoft. He also spent 10 years at Sun Microsystems. Larry has Electrical Engineering degrees from Stanford University.

speakers.name: Lydia Fitzpatrick
speakers.bio: Lydia is a Technical Program Manager in Android focusing on device vitals. She runs program across the Android organization to improve quality and performance. Her goal is to make Android the fastest, most stable, longest lasting mobile OS. Previously she worked at Amazon on ML and UI programs. She has a B.S. in C.S. from NKU.
